summary: Responding to the COVID-19 pandemic, Congress appropriated $908 million of supplemental funding to the State Department and USAID for international humanitarian assistance in FY 2020. Both agencies began communicating with organizations remotely to oversee how these funds are spent. For instance, they have relied on video conferences and online reports (instead of in-person site visits) to ensure these funds are being spent effectively. However, USAID...
title: COVID-19: Better USAID Documentation and More-Frequent Reporting Could Enhance Monitoring of Humanitarian Efforts
